question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable. Help me write a program that mimics Windows Remote Desktop, with the requirement that it can manage multiple IP addresses. Other functionality should remain unchanged.

checklist.title: Is the IP address management system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code implements a comprehensive IP address management system including adding, editing, deleting, and validating IP addresses. Check for categorization options (e.g., by department, frequency of use), search/filter functionality, and batch operations. Score 0 if no IP management exists, 5 if only basic CRUD operations are available, and 10 if advanced management features are included.

checklist.title: Is the remote desktop connection functionality properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code correctly implements RDP protocol or utilizes appropriate libraries (e.g., FreeRDP, xfreerdp, Remmina) with proper parameters. Check if connection settings like screen resolution, color depth, audio redirection, and clipboard sharing are configurable. Deduct 5 points if the connection implementation is incomplete, and 3 points if advanced options are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are authentication mechanisms secure and comprehensive?
checklist.description: Check if the code implements secure authentication methods (username/password, certificates, multi-factor authentication), credential storage (encrypted, not plain text), and session management. Evaluate whether it includes timeout settings and secure credential handling. Deduct 5 points for plaintext password storage, 3 points for missing credential management UI, and 5 points for lack of session security features. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is session management and multi-connection handling implemented?
checklist.description: Review if the code properly manages multiple concurrent RDP connections, allows switching between active sessions, and implements features like thumbnails of active connections, connection status indicators, and session restoration. Check for proper resource allocation and release when connecting/disconnecting. Deduct 5 points if simultaneous connections aren't supported, 3 points if session state isn't preserved. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as network timeouts, authentication failures, dropped connections, invalid IP formats) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Check for proper exception handling, logging, and automatic reconnection attempts. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Auto-discovery of machines on local network 2. Performance monitoring of remote sessions 3. Screen recording/session playback 4. Wake-on-LAN integration 5. Custom connection profiles with different security levels). Add 2 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar connection methods 2. Function modules unrelated to remote desktop management (e.g., a built-in web browser) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., unnecessary animations in the connection interface). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating connection logic/UI/credential management), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Check for proper error handling, logging, and configuration management. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching consistent with Windows UI guidelines 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times) 4) Intuitive connection status indicators. Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for inconsistent styling with Windows UI, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Connection initiation feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance during connection process. Evaluate responsiveness during connection establishment and remote session interaction. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for laggy interface transitions, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
